snippet: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki said Thursday he had agreed to step down, conceding to pressure from within Iraq and the United States and Iran.
abstract: Iraqi Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki agrees to step down and end challenge to nomination of his replacement Haider al-Abadi; decision comes after pressure from within Iraq and the United States and Iran, and holds out prospect of peaceful transition of power.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Suadad al-Salhy, Ben Hubbard and Omar Al-Jawoshy from Baghdad, and Michael D. Shear from Edgartown, Mass.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki said Thursday he had agreed to step down, conceding to pressure from within Iraq and the United States and Iran.

headline.main: Maliki Agrees to Relinquish Power in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Premier of Iraq Accedes to Calls to Give Up Power
